ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Further developed skills in Portuguese.

This course helped me develop a stronger grasp of the Portuguese language while also significantly deepening my understanding of Brazilian culture and art. I feel as though I became a more critical student of Latin American politics and culture through our studies.
I learned more about the Portuguese Language and Brazillian culture.
Portuguese
Portuguese reading, writing, speaking, and listening.
A great course that continued to teach me Portuguese in a fun and effective way. We also learned about part of Brazilian culture that was very interesting.
Vocabulary around climate and social movements, verb tenses, longer form writing style and various comparison structures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Encouraging learning environment, diverse materials used for teaching

I think the course really effectively expanded my grasp on the culture of the region (especially with regards to art), but I would have enjoyed more thorough instruction on grammar/oral proficiency etc to feel more competent in the language.
This is a very strong course since I learned much about Brazillian culture.
Great teacher, interesting material
Very interesting, hard having work daily.
I enjoyed the level of student engagement and how everyone has to participate in class. The asynchronous days were also helpful.
I really liked all the different forms of media the class drew from (art, books, movies, documentaries). The asynchronous dates were also super helpful to work on projects or do larger assignments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Portuguese is a beautiful language and it is great to be able to develop your skills through diverse media forms. Be warned that the course can be disorganized at times.
Yes for sure. The language class isn't too difficult and doesn't swamp you in work which is great. You learn a lot about Brazillian culture.
100% take this class
Yes, I love the Portuguese department. They are about helping the student in any way they can.

I would definitely recommend the course. If you want to continue learning in an environment where the professors are all very engaging and students participate actively, you should definitely take it. I also learn like I am learning a lot in a stres-free environment.
Yes especially for the language requirement.
